title: Normal growth and development of School

questions.question: During the school-age period, general growth is rapid and completed before puberty.
At 6 years old, the average height of a child is about 150cm.
The pulse rate of a school-age child is typically around 90-110 beats per minute.
The urinary system becomes functionally mature and can concentrate urine better during this age.
The circulatory system’s functional murmur is usually significant and requires medical intervention.
The skeletal and muscular systems may experience aches, so correct posture should be encouraged.
The endocrine system is fully mature in all functions, including reproductive regulation.
According to Piaget, the child takes more responsibility and orders activities, transitioning from objective thinking to egocentric.
The neurological system during school age has full voluntary control of gross motor function.
Lymphoid tissues reach greater amounts in adults than in school-age children.
According to Freud, during latency, the child’s main focus shifts from socialization to sexuality.
Erikson’s psychosocial crisis for this stage is Autonomy vs Shame.
According to Freud, the latency period extends from 7–12 years.
Piaget classified children aged 7–11 years in the preoperational stage.
A 10-year-old child can typically write short letters to friends and read storybooks.
Children at 8 years can usually count to 20 and identify their right arm.
The stage of cooperation in moral development usually appears around age 6.
Socially, 7-year-old children begin to enjoy group games and sharing.
Spiritually, 11-year-old children believe their prayers should be answered.
Poor posture in school-age children may lead to skeletal issues such as scoliosis.
Obesity and underfeeding are both considered nutritional problems in this age group.
Bullying is usually a one-time act and not repetitive in nature.
Streptococcal infections are associated with nephritis.
Abuse in children can include physical abuse only.
The nurse should monitor immunization status and booster dose requirements for school-age children.
According to motor development, a 7-year-old child is able to jump and ride a tricycle.

options: Help in household, skillful in manual activity

options: Be aware of family roles and responsibilities
